etymology.description: 推 (push) + 拉 (pull) = paired opposite actions used together.
etymology.interpretation: Pairs two opposite motion verbs to express applying force forward or backward. Common on doors and for describing opposing forces or a push–pull dynamic.

parts.english: to push; to shove; to promote; to infer
to pull; to drag; to draw; to play (a string instrument)

examples.chinese: 门上写着“推”和“拉”(門上寫著「推」和「拉」。)
examples.english: The door has “push” and “pull” written on it.

examples.chinese: 请先推一下(請先推一下)，再拉开门(再拉開門)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng xiān tuī yíxià, zài lā kāi mén.
examples.english: Please push first, then pull the door open.

examples.chinese: 两人你推我拉地搬沙发(兩人你推我拉地搬沙發)。
examples.pinyin: Liǎng rén nǐ tuī wǒ lā de bān shāfā.
examples.english: The two of them moved the sofa, one pushing and the other pulling.
